intro: Chabraea barrasiana, commonly known as the Barrasian chabraea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, clustered in inflorescences, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
